* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* [can eat metal](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* waits for you to come. |                                                                                                                  |

A **xorn monk**, X, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). They are a type of [xorn](/wiki/Xorn_\(monster_class\) "Xorn (monster class)") that act as a servant of [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen").

Xorn monks have the same claw and bite attacks as a regular [xorn](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn"), but their claw attacks are stronger and they also possess a pair of kick attacks. They are also [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless") and [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious"), and have the same ability to [phase](/wiki/Phase "Phase") through walls.

## Generation

Xorn monks are always generated hostile and [meditating](/wiki/Meditating "Meditating"). They are not a valid monster form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Xorn monks are primarily generated on the [Monk quest](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest"), where they make up 1⁄6 of the randomly generated monsters in the branch. Several floors of the Monk quest also generate xorn monks at level creation: three are generated on the locate level, one is generated in each of the lower filler levels, and four are generated on the goal level.

Xorn monks [generate with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a pair of [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots"), a pair of [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves"), a [sedge hat](/index.php?title=Sedge_hat\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sedge hat (page does not exist)"), and a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), all sized to fit the monster and subject to the following generation rules:

- The cloak has a 1⁄50 chance of being a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance"), and will otherwise be a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe"); the cloak will have its enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation.

- The cloak glyph will be colored orange, as well as the boots and gloves if they are non-metallic.

- Both gloves and boots will have their enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation, and may be given the following [properties](/wiki/Object_properties#dNetHack "Object properties"):

  - Each set of gloves and boots has a separate 1⁄10 chance of being either bladed or spiked, with an equal probability of each.
  - They each have a 1⁄50 chance of being freezing, shocking or flaming, with an equal probability of each. Otherwise, they each have a 1⁄20 chance of being frosted, sparking or red-hot, with an equal probability of each.
  - They each have a 1⁄50 chance of being anarchic, holy or unholy, with an equal probability of each. Otherwise, they each have a 1⁄20 chance of being unruly, consecrated or desecrated, with an equal probability of each.

- The boots will be one of the following:

  - [Low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots") (3⁄4 chance)
  - [High boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots") (3⁄16 chance)
  - [Kicking boots](/wiki/Kicking_boots "Kicking boots") (1⁄24 chance)
  - [Water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots") (1⁄144 chance)
  - [Flying boots](/index.php?title=Flying_boots_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Flying boots (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") (1⁄144 chance)
  - [Speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots") (1⁄144 chance)

* *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Xorn_monk\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Xorn monk

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
X xorn monk (No tile)
Difficulty 14
Attacks claw 1d8 physical, claw 1d8 physical, claw 1d8 physical, kick 1d8 physical, kick 1d8 physical, bite 4d6 physical
X xorn monk (No tile)
Difficulty 14
Attacks

claw 1d8 physical, claw 1d8 physical, claw 1d8 physical, kick 1d8 physical, kick 1d8 physical, bite 4d6 physical

Base level 10
Base experience 279
Speed 9
Base AC -2
Base MR 20
Alignment -10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 700
Size medium
Resistances fire, cold, petrification
Resistances conveyed petrification

A xorn monk:

  • can phase through walls.
  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • has a thick hide.
  • can eat metal.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • waits for you to come.

A xorn monk, X, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. They are a type of xorn that act as a servant of Master Kaen.

Xorn monks have the same claw and bite attacks as a regular xorn, but their claw attacks are stronger and they also possess a pair of kick attacks. They are also breathless and amphibious, and have the same ability to phase through walls.

Generation

Xorn monks are always generated hostile and meditating. They are not a valid monster form for polymorph.

Xorn monks are primarily generated on the Monk quest, where they make up 1⁄6 of the randomly generated monsters in the branch. Several floors of the Monk quest also generate xorn monks at level creation: three are generated on the locate level, one is generated in each of the lower filler levels, and four are generated on the goal level.

Xorn monks generate with a pair of boots, a pair of gloves, a sedge hat, and a cloak, all sized to fit the monster and subject to the following generation rules:

  • The cloak has a 1⁄50 chance of being a cloak of magic resistance, and will otherwise be a robe; the cloak will have its enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation.
  • The cloak glyph will be colored orange, as well as the boots and gloves if they are non-metallic.
  • Both gloves and boots will have their enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation, and may be given the following properties:
    • Each set of gloves and boots has a separate 1⁄10 chance of being either bladed or spiked, with an equal probability of each.
    • They each have a 1⁄50 chance of being freezing, shocking or flaming, with an equal probability of each. Otherwise, they each have a 1⁄20 chance of being frosted, sparking or red-hot, with an equal probability of each.
    • They each have a 1⁄50 chance of being anarchic, holy or unholy, with an equal probability of each. Otherwise, they each have a 1⁄20 chance of being unruly, consecrated or desecrated, with an equal probability of each.
  • The boots will be one of the following:
    • Low boots (3⁄4 chance)
    • High boots (3⁄16 chance)
    • Kicking boots (1⁄24 chance)
    • Water walking boots (1⁄144 chance)
    • Flying boots (1⁄144 chance)
    • Speed boots (1⁄144 chance)

A '''xorn monk''', {{orange|X}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. They are a type of [[Xorn (monster class)|xorn]] that act as a servant of [[Master Kaen]].

Xorn monks have the same claw and bite attacks as a regular [[xorn]], but their claw attacks are stronger and they also possess a pair of kick attacks. They are also [[breathless]] and [[amphibious]], and have the same ability to [[phase]] through walls.

==Generation==
Xorn monks are always generated hostile and [[meditating]]. They are not a valid monster form for [[polymorph]].

Xorn monks are primarily generated on the [[Monk quest]], where they make up {{frac|6}} of the randomly generated monsters in the branch. Several floors of the Monk quest also generate xorn monks at level creation: three are generated on the locate level, one is generated in each of the lower filler levels, and four are generated on the goal level.

Xorn monks [[Monster starting inventory|generate with]] a pair of [[boots]], a pair of [[gloves]], a [[sedge hat]], and a [[cloak]], all sized to fit the monster and subject to the following generation rules:<!--completion pending trying to parse all the code for it-->

* The cloak has a {{frac|50}} chance of being a [[cloak of magic resistance]], and will otherwise be a [[robe]]; the cloak will have its enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation.
* The cloak glyph will be colored orange, as well as the boots and gloves if they are non-metallic.
* Both gloves and boots will have their enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation, and may be given the following [[Object properties#dNetHack|properties]]:
** Each set of gloves and boots has a separate {{frac|10}} chance of being either bladed or spiked, with an equal probability of each.
** They each have a {{frac|50}} chance of being freezing, shocking or flaming, with an equal probability of each. Otherwise, they each have a {{frac|20}} chance of being frosted, sparking or red-hot, with an equal probability of each.
** They each have a {{frac|50}} chance of being anarchic, holy or unholy, with an equal probability of each. Otherwise, they each have a {{frac|20}} chance of being unruly, consecrated or desecrated, with an equal probability of each.
* The boots will be one of the following:
** [[Low boots]] ({{frac|3|4}} chance)
** [[High boots]] ({{frac|3|16}} chance)
** [[Kicking boots]] ({{frac|24}} chance)
** [[Water walking boots]] ({{frac|144}} chance)
** [[Flying boots (dNetHack)|Flying boots]] ({{frac|144}} chance)
** [[Speed boots]] ({{frac|144}} chance)
